contentrichtext.text: {{Underlinked|date=June 2013}} "Preparedness is the adult response to the knowledge that sometimes, at some level, things go haywire."<ref>www.fortomorrowwe.blogspot.com</ref> Emergency preparedness ranges from making sure your car has plenty of fuel to some sort of "Doomsday" scenario. The driving forces behind preparedness are varied, but include religious beliefs,<ref>http://www.lds.org/topics/emergency-preparedness</ref> popular culture,<ref>http://channel.nationalgeographic.com/channel/doomsday-preppers/</ref> or just a desire for a self-reliant lifestyle.<ref>http://readyforanything.org/</ref><ref>http://www.lds.org/topic/self-reliance/</ref> While the "prepper" community tends to prepare more for doomsday, or SHTF(S*** Hits The Fan) scenario, there are many who try to be prepared for any type of emergency. The government encourages preparedness through www.ready.gov and the [[FEMA | Federal Emergency Management Agency's]] Community Emergency Response Team[[Community_emergency_response_teams | (CERT)]] program<ref>http://www.fema.gov/community-emergency-response-teams</ref> Preparedness is a part of [[Emergency management|Emergency Management]], which includes: * Prevention * [[Preparedness]] * Mitigation * Response * Recovery ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Emergency management]]
